phys::UI::Window Class Reference

This is a container widget capable of holding any other widget. More...

Detailed Description

This is a container widget capable of holding any other widget.

)

Standard initialization constructor.

Parameters:
name The name of the window.
Position The position of the window.
Size The size of the window.
Layer The parent layer this window belongs to.

Member Function Documentation

bool phys::UI::Window::CheckMouseHover (  )  [virtual]

Checks to see if the current mouse position is over this window.

Returns:
Returns a bool value, true if the mouse is over this window, false if it's not.

Button * phys::UI::Window::CreateButton ( ConstString &  Name,
const Vector2  Position,
const Vector2  Size 
)

Creates a button within this Window.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created button.
Parameters:
Name The name of the button.
Position The top left position of the button.
Size The size of the Button.

)

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created Button List Box.
Parameters:
Name The name of the Button List Box.
Position The top left position of the Button List Box.
Size The size of the Button List Box.
ScrollbarWidth The relative width of the scrollbar thats created with this widget.
ScrollbarStyle The style of scrollbar you want to create, see Scrollbar documentation for more details.

Caption * phys::UI::Window::CreateCaption ( ConstString &  Name,
const Vector2  Position,
const Vector2  Size,
const Whole  Glyph,
String  Text 
)

Creates a caption within this Window.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created caption.
Parameters:
Name The name of this caption.
Position The top left position of the caption.
Size The size of the Button.
Glyph One of the glyphs specified in your gorilla file. Must be valid.
Text Any text you want printed on the caption.

Definition at line 596 of file uiwindow.cpp.

UI::CheckBox * phys::UI::Window::CreateCheckBox ( ConstString &  Name,
const Vector2  Position,
const Vector2  Size,
const Whole  Glyph,
String &  LabelText 
)

Creates a CheckBox within this Window.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).

Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created CheckBox.
Parameters:
Name The name of the CheckBox.
Position The top left position of the CheckBox.
Size The size of the CheckBox.
Glyph The glyphs to use by default for use with the label. Glyphs are defined in your .gorilla file.
LabelText The text to display with the label. The label uses the Markup Text class, and thus it's light markup text language. You can also pass in a blank string if you don't wish to have a label, you can create a label after construction.

Definition at line 659 of file uiwindow.cpp.

Rectangle * phys::UI::Window::CreateRectangle ( const Vector2  Position,
const Vector2  Size 
)

Creates a rectangle within this Window.

This constructor expects relative values for position and size(values from 0.0 to 1.0).
Rectangles are innately put behind all captions, so z-order is not necessary.

Parameters:
Position The top left position of the button.
Size The size of the Button.

Vector2 phys::UI::Window::GetPosition (  )  [virtual]

Gets the relative position of this window.

The position is relative to the screen size. Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.

Returns:
Returns a vector2 representing the relative position of this window.
